items.title: Right triangle
items.snippet:
In the image above, you see that in triangle $\triangle ABC$ , angle C has a 
measure of 90 degrees, so $\triangle ABC$ is a right triangle. The sides of a right 
triangle have different names: The longest side, opposite the right angle, is called 
the hypotenuse. In the diagram, the hypotenuse is labelled c. The other two sides
 ...

items.title: Right triangle - Wikipedia
items.snippet:
A right triangle (American English) or right-angled triangle (British English) is a 
triangle in which one angle is a right angle The relation between the sides and 
angles of a right triangle is the basis for trigonometry. The side opposite the right 
angle is called the hypotenuse (side c in the figure). The sides adjacent to the 
right ...

items.title: Hypotenuse - Wikipedia
items.snippet:
In geometry, a hypotenuse (rarely: hypothenuse) is the longest side of a right-
angled triangle, the side opposite of the right angle. The length of the hypotenuse 
of a right triangle can be found using the Pythagorean theorem, which states that 
the square of the length of the hypotenuse equals the sum of the squares of the ...

items.title: What is name of the longest side of a triangle?
items.htmlTitle: What is name of the longest side of a triangle?
items.snippet:
What is name of the longest side of a triangle - trivia question /questions answer / 
answers. ... I don't know if there is a word for the longest side of any triangle. ... 
The answer is "the longest side" UNLESS it is a RIGHT ANGLED triangle (which 
can be an isosceles or scalene) in which case it is called the ...

question.name: What is name of the longest side of a triangle?
question.author: freddy_krueger

answer.text: Hypotenuse refers to the longest side of a right-angled triangle. I don't know if there is a word for the longest side of any triangle.
answer.author: Roget

answer.text: yes sorry, didn't realised i missed out 'right angled'
answer.author: freddy_krueger

answer.text: Roget: They are called that on all of them... although there isn't a hypotenuse on a equilateral triangle, only on scalene and issosceles
answer.author: elizabethmc

answer.text: I checked two dictionaries and an encyclopedia and they all stated that the the term only applies to a right-angled triangle.
answer.author: Roget

answer.text: The answer is "the longest side" UNLESS it is a RIGHT ANGLED triangle (which can be an isosceles or scalene) in which case it is called the HYPOTENUSE !
answer.author: sequoianoir

answer.text: This was posted 5 days ago, and I think we've already settled this haven't we? I just missed out the word 'right-angled'.
answer.author: freddy_krueger

answer.text: Yes freddy I was aware it just seemed that the "entire correct" answer needed posting.
answer.author: sequoianoir

items.title: Why is the longest side in a right-angled triangle called the ...
items.htmlTitle: Why is the longest side in a right-angled triangle called the ...
items.snippet:
Check Online Etymology Dictionary (Online Etymology Dictionary) — the term 
comes from Greek “hypoteinousa” signifying a line stretching under a right angle 
which is what a hypotenuse is.
items.htmlSnippet:

comes from Greek “hypoteinousa” signifying a line stretching under a right angle
which is what a hypotenuse is.

items.title: How is the hypotenuse the longest side of any right triangle ...
items.htmlTitle: How is the hypotenuse the longest side of any right triangle ...
items.snippet:
All of this together shows that the side opposite the 90 degree angle is the 
longest side in the triangle. In a similar fashion, you can show that even for 
triangles which are not right triangles, the side opposite the biggest angle will be 
the biggest side. share|cite|improve this answer. answered Oct 26 '14 at 2: ...

qapage.title: How is the hypotenuse the longest side of any right triangle?
qapage.name: How is the hypotenuse the longest side of any right triangle?
qapage.description: I see that the hypotenuse of a right triangle is opposite the right angle, but how is it always the longest side? I also know that it connects to endpoints of other sides. Please help me out with...

question.name: How is the hypotenuse the longest side of any right triangle?
question.text: I see that the hypotenuse of a right triangle is opposite the right angle, but how is it always the longest side? I also know that it connects to endpoints of other sides. Please help me out...

metatags.twitter:title: How is the hypotenuse the longest side of any right triangle?
metatags.twitter:description: I see that the hypotenuse of a right triangle is opposite the right angle, but how is it always the longest side?  I also know that it connects to endpoints of other sides.  Please help me out with...

answer.text: Let a be the hypotenuse and b,c the others sides, then by Pythagorean Theorem a2=b2+c2. Then a2>b2,a2>c2. Therefore a>ba>c.
Alternatively, you have the law of sines: For any triangle with sides, A,B,C and corresponding angles a,b,c with angle a opposite side A et cetera, you have the following: sin⁡aA=sin⁡bB=sin⁡c...
If the angles are ∠A≤∠B<∠C, then the sides are a≤b<c. On a right triangle, two angles are acute and the third is a right angle. Hence the side opposite the right angle is the longest side.
